alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Logan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 2:04PM CDT until July 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Dover affecting Kingfisher and Logan Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Dover. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, The river remains within its banks through Kingfisher County and into western Logan County. Some oilfield equipment in low bottoms may be isolated for a short time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to fall. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CDT.
